annotation: Kirsten Marie's short description of the basilisk is unusual in that she does not actually name the creature. Other stories suggest that the basilisk hatches from the eggs of roosters (DS II E 210).
danish_manuscript:
I Mjødtønderne kan der avles nogle store
Dyr, der ordentlig kan slaa imod saa det kan skvalpe inden i
dem.
english_manuscript: Some big animals could grow in mead casks that could really hit on the sides so that it would splash about inside them.
danish_publication: I mjødtønderne kan der avles nogle store dyr, der ordentlig kan slå mod siderne, så det kan skvalpe inden i tønderne.
english_publication: Some big animals could grow in mead casks, and they could really hit on the sides so that it would splash about inside the casks.
